page.title: 11A working farm 2.Cookham.
page.content: Cookham Farm covers 50 acres(25 hectares) and is typical of the small farms is this area.30 acres of the land produce wheat and the rest is used for growing vegetables and wallflowers.The grain is sold directly to the flourmills.The vegetables are sold locally and the wallflowers are sent to the New Covent Garden market. The farmer works the farm on his own and much of the work is done manually.He owns 3 tractors(one using cage wheels for rolling in the seeds)and a variety of agricultural machinery.The soil is chalky and falls in category 10.There are 2 houses on the farm ,one lived in by the farmer and the other by a non-farmer tenant.
